Ecclesiasticus *__31.1: Watching for riches consumeth the flesh, and the thought thereof driveth away sleep.
Ecclesiasticus *__31.2: The thinking beforehand turneth away the understanding, and a grievous sickness maketh the soul sober.
Ecclesiasticus *__31.3: The rich man hath laboured in gathering riches together, and when he resteth he shall be filled with his goods.
Ecclesiasticus *__31.4: The poor man hath laboured in his low way of life, and in the end he is still poor.
Ecclesiasticus *__31.5: He that loveth gold, shall not be justified: and he that followeth after corruption, shall be filled with it.
Ecclesiasticus *__31.6: Many have been brought to fall for gold, and the beauty thereof hath been their ruin.
Ecclesiasticus *__31.7: Gold is a stumblingblock to them that sacrifice to it: woe to them that eagerly follow after it, and every fool shall perish by it.
Ecclesiasticus *__31.8: Blessed is the rich man that is found without blemish: and that hath not gone after gold, nor put his trust in money nor in treasures.
Ecclesiasticus *__31.9: Who is he, and we will praise him? for he hath done wonderful things in his life.
Ecclesiasticus *__31.10: Who hath been tried thereby, and made perfect, he shall have glory everlasting. He that could have transgressed, and hath not transgressed: and could do evil things, and hath not done them:
Ecclesiasticus *__31.11: Therefore are his goods established in the Lord, and all the church of the saints shall declare his alms.
Ecclesiasticus *__31.12: Art thou set at a great table? be not the first to open thy mouth upon it.
Ecclesiasticus *__31.13: Say not: There are many things which are upon it.
Ecclesiasticus *__31.14: Remember that a wicked eye is evil.
Ecclesiasticus *__31.15: What is created more wicked than an eye? therefore shall it weep over all the face when it shall see.
Ecclesiasticus *__31.16: Stretch not out thy hand first, lest being disgraced with envy thou be put to confusion.
Ecclesiasticus *__31.17: Be not hasty in a feast.
Ecclesiasticus *__31.18: Judge of the disposition of thy neighbour by thyself.
Ecclesiasticus *__31.19: Use as a frugal man the things that are set before thee: lest if thou eatest much, thou be hated.
Ecclesiasticus *__31.20: Leave off first, for manners' sake: and exceed not, lest thou offend.
Ecclesiasticus *__31.21: And if thou sittest among many, reach not thy hand out first of all: and be not the first to ask for drink.
Ecclesiasticus *__31.22: How sufficient is a little wine for a man well taught, and in sleeping thou shalt not be uneasy with it, and thou shalt feel no pain.
Ecclesiasticus *__31.23: Watching, and choler, and gripes, are with an intemperate man:
Ecclesiasticus *__31.24: Sound and wholesome sleep with a moderate man: he shall sleep till morning, and his soul shall be delighted with him.
Ecclesiasticus *__31.25: And if thou hast been forced to eat much, arise, go out, and vomit: and it shall refresh thee, and thou shalt not bring sickness upon thy body.
Ecclesiasticus *__31.26: Hear me, my son, and despise me not: and in the end thou shalt find my words.
Ecclesiasticus *__31.27: In all thy works be quick, and no infirmity shall come to thee.
Ecclesiasticus *__31.28: The lips of many shall bless him that is liberal of his bread, and the testimony of his truth is faithful.
Ecclesiasticus *__31.29: Against him that is niggardly of his bread, the city will murmur, and the testimony of his niggardliness is true.
Ecclesiasticus *__31.30: Challenge not them that love wine: for wine hath destroyed very many.
Ecclesiasticus *__31.31: Fire trieth hard iron: so wine drunk to excess shall rebuke the hearts of the proud.
Ecclesiasticus *__31.32: Wine taken with sobriety is equal life to men: if thou drink it moderately, thou shalt be sober.
Ecclesiasticus *__31.33: What is his life, who is diminished with wine?
Ecclesiasticus *__31.35: Wine was created from the beginning to make men joyful, and not to make them drunk.
Ecclesiasticus *__31.36: Wine drunken with moderation is the joy of the soul and the heart.
Ecclesiasticus *__31.37: Sober drinking is health to soul and body.
Ecclesiasticus *__31.38: Wine drunken with excess raiseth quarrels; and wrath, and many ruins.
Ecclesiasticus *__31.39: Wine drunken with excess is bitterness of the soul.
Ecclesiasticus *__31.40: The heat of drunkenness is the stumblingblock of the fool, lessening strength and causing wounds.
Ecclesiasticus *__31.41: Rebuke not thy neighbour in a banquet of wine: and despise him not in his mirth.
Ecclesiasticus *__31.42: Speak not to him words of reproach: and press him not in demanding again.
